turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Morcar.
turn.1: What was the Battle of Morcar?
turn.2: When, however, Tostig and his ally Harald Hardrada invaded Northumbria in September, Morcar evidently was not ready to meet them; and it was not until York was threatened that, having then been joined by Edwin , he went out against them with a large army.
turn.3: Who was the leader of the Battle of Morcar?
turn.4: The two earls were defeated at Fulford Gate, near York, in a fierce battle, in which, according to a Norse authority, Morcar seems to have been prominent.
turn.5: Was anyone else involved in the Battle of Morcar?
turn.6: York was surrendered, and Harold Godwinson had to march in haste to save the north by the Battle of Stamford Bridge.
turn.7: What happened after the Battle of Morcar?
turn.8: Ungrateful for this deliverance, Morcar and his brother held back the forces of the north from joining Harold, in the defence of the kingdom against the Normans.
turn.9: Did Morcar go to another battle?
turn.10: After the battle of Hastings, Morcar and his brother arrived at London, sent their sister Ealdgyth, Harold's widow, to Chester, and urged the citizens to raise one or other of them to the throne.
turn.11: Was there another battle after the Battle of Hastings?
turn.12: They concurred in the election of Edgar the Ætheling, but disappointed of their hope left the city with their forces and returned to the north, believing that the Conqueror would not advance so far.
